result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devin J Chestnut

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Devin J Chestnut
Current: N3501 Hwy 35 Lot 210, Onalaska, WI 54650 United States  (Effective: 04-17-2015)
Prior: 1000 Copeland Ave., La Crosse, WI 54603

Def in court w/Atty Patricia L. O'Neil.  Jessica Skemp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM316
Ct. 1 - Retail theft - Guilty
Ct. 2 - Retail theft - Guilty
15CF189 - dismissed and read in
  Plea Quest filed/signed/understands
Understands const rights waived
Understands elements of crime
No promises/threats
No alc/drugs/meds in the last 24 hrs
  Plea is F, V & I made. Sufficient factual basis to support the plea and the def is found guilty.
Skemp: Only one prior for Para. But w/ the possession of meth, his drug use has escalated and he's in need of trmt
O'Neil: he lost his job at Burger King due to the meth case. They will take him back after 6 mos. 
Def: I am ready to be clean
Crt: I will add some com service hrs for rehabilitative than as a penalty since you aren't employed and it's healthy for you to do something positive in the community. 
SENTENCE:
Sentence withheld - 12 mos  probation
Cond:   Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.  Do not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from a licensed physician. Random testing; any other evals or programming deemed approp by PO and follow thru w/ any recommendations. Pay rest to Sears in the amt of $319.98 plus surcharge.  Perform  30  hrs com service. 4 days credit. Pay DOC fees & CC. 973.015 trmt upon successful  completion of probation.

11:24 am Def in court w/ Atty Patricia L. O'Neil.  Jessica Skemp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Prelim waiver filed - signed/understands.  No promises/threats.
OURT finds the PH is F & V waived.  Bound over for trial.
Information filed - Reading waived.  Def Pleads NG - NG Pleas entered.
PLEA HRG:  4/14 at 9:15 am   SLH
O'Neil asks that the GPS be removed.  Skemp asked for curfew and not house arrest.  I'll leave it to the Court's descretion.
COURT will lift the GPS and house arrest provisions from the bond.
e-js
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 14, 2015 at 09:15 am.

Def in custody w/Atty Beatty
  Pretrial report filed
$2500 sig bond signed (15CF189&15CM316) w/cond: no contact w/Sears, no CS w/o Rx, comply w/JS w/testing, GPS house arrest
PH:3/30 @ 11 (SLH)
